alert.note: Alert for Sampson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 12:20PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Sampson County through 100 PM EDT... At 1220 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ammon, or 14 miles northeast of Elizabethtown, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harrells and Garland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: This thunderstorm is producing an excessive amount of deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter indoors and stay away from windows. If you cannot seek shelter indoors, an enclosed vehicle can provide safe shelter. Deadly lightning strikes can occur well ahead of an approaching storm, prior to the arrival of rain and wind. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
